name: prius_chaser
text: Remember when Lyle was two Lyles big?

name: roastbeet
text: A comment left by roastbeet was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ishuta, goocifer, ActualTaunt, Sprog, Magb, Zem)

name: wolfslice
text: I also had not noticed this. Nice.

name: deimosrising
text: Lyle has many properties. Because his cells are permanently saturated with alcohol, to which he has a powerful psychic bond, he can alter his size at will by expelling or imbibing liquors.

name: baryonyx
text: Like midi-chlorians but with less of that VZZZOOM WOOOHM, y'know?

name: snowman
text: You win the No-Prize!

name: antsama
text: Your thoughts on Lyle size should be published in a journal of moderate importance!

name: factorial
text: yelled Batman.

text: Finally made an account just to give this its 100th chubby.

name: afronaut
text: Remember when lyle's moustache was a batman boomarang?

name: jlynes
text: Or, if you will, a "Bat-a-rang".

name: rowboat
text: You have upstaged the guy with the Dr. Who avatar in nerdiness.

name: jhunt
text: Man, if you are watching Suirvivor without drinking, you are making a serious error in judgement.

name: mustakrakesh
text: I'm just wondering whe Ray is going to get dressed. When was the thong introduced?

name: retinarow
text: Turns out it's the next strip.

name: arcibi
text: How the dudes have changed since this strip

name: nexus
text: Yeah, Roast Beef sounds as edgy as Lyle or Ray

name: gompo
text: His facial expressions are kind of sad and discongruous with what he's saying, though.

name: saint
text:
It feels so weird to see Beef using actual punctuation.

Strange and distantly familiar, a visit to past times.

name: fuckyoufriday
text: I thought dogs couldn't talk! I guess they could still lose at poker, though.

name: honesttom
text: I saw a painting like that once.

name: bourbonsamurai
text: Dogs can definitely talk. Remember Scrambles? He was lost.

name: delzhand
text: Beef with punctuation?  Weeeeeeeird.

name: zefiel
text: OH GOD MAN THAT IS SO WAAAACKYYYYY

name: djwhiterabbit
text: also Beef speaking in a same-sized font as everyone else.

name: spectre
text: And he SMOKES!

name: vice
text:
The question mark leads the current
to
the
bomb

OHHHHHHH SHIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIIT!

name: tombsgrave
text: A comment left by tombsgrave was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by madnes, Six_Times, Overmedicated, equinn2006, hikikomori, luckypyjamas)

name: rowboat
text: Onstad can teach us all something about perseverance. If I had come in on either of the last two strips, or even if I'd started at the beginning and worked my way up to this point, I wouldn't have given a damn about those cats and may not have even kept reading (there is a dip in quality to start 2002). There's a palpable sense of Onstad pondering dropping the whole thing and getting a real job around this time. I now have double appreciation for the magic trick that he pulled to eventually right the ship and turn it into gold. Onstad can teach us all something about perseverance.

name: sidecar
text: Perfect introductory and concluding sentences.

name: expellens
text: Rowboat; After having read the strip for a few months now, I finally came to appreciate Onstad's genius for character development. The Great Outdoor Fight arc hooked me once Ray's mom came to visit and Beef immediately went into polite 8 year old mode. I took the plunge and started reading the strips in chronological order (and created my profile t' boot).  I give you double appreciation mad chubbies for stating my growing unease so eloquently.

name: spectre
text: First mention of Ray's name.

name: professorhazard
text: Also the first appearance of Ray's medallion. The thong, however, is still MIA.

name: recognizer
text: The Dog. Yet another in Achewood's legacy of Characters Whom We Never See.

name: saint
text: you know, it's a good setup, but Achewood has come a long way since these strips.

name: drgetz
text: Indeed it has come a long way. I love seeing comic characters develop.

name: confusion
text: Are we talking about Wendy's founder Dave Thomas here?

name: hamscout
text:
I believe the alt text is referring to that Dave Thomas, but died on 1/8/02, which might explain Onstad's blown concentration during this disaster...

...all thinking about square burgers and Frostys..
...Dave Thomas' body iced on display in a modified "Super Bar"...

name: girlandagun
text: Quite understandably. I get the feeling Roast Beef spent a good portion of his childhood scrounging in the dumpster for leftover frosty.

name: trevor328
text: When I first read this strip I thought that Dave Thomas--the singer from Pere Ubu--had died. I almost cried.

name: chachibenji
text:
Ugh Beef with full punctuation and even emitting a haughty "hah!"
Sad face.

name: drunkenimp
text: Roast Beef does not watch the Survivor TV show.

name: zapatos
text: Everyone is freaking out about RB here, I'm guessing cigarettes just helped his depression... for a time.

name: philipmarschall
text: hahaahahahhaahahahaahahahahahahahaha

name: puguglypress
text:
Lyle is drawn big because he is the focus of the strip, much like classical Japanese paintings where drowning sailors in the background were painted larger than safe observers in the foreground.

also LOL on Beef saying "retarded"

name: puguglypress
text: also "OF course" is maybe the first use of good dialogue in the strip's history

name: possums
text: What is even the point of this strip? This is almost as bad as the AIDS comic.

name: vermy
text: It's not a bad strip. It just feels grossly wrong in light of future additions to canon. We're glancing into a weird, awkward parallel universe where Beef seems to have no special lingo or psychological problems and dogs have the same social standing as cats. Heck, in this world, Roast Beef and Ray might even be owned by humans. But we will never know, sadly. This is a continuity that opened and closed in a single strip, a kind of cosmic burp.
